articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 'Friends' cast reunion special remains a 'maybe' for HBO Max
articles.description: The “Friends” reunion will be there for you — maybe
articles.content:
PASADENA, Calif. -- 
The Friends reunion will be there for you. Maybe.
There's interest all the way around in bringing the stars of the hit sitcom together again, said HBO Max chief content officer Kevin Reilly. And yet we can't seem to quite get that inter… [+544 chars]

articles.author: SONIA PÉREZ D. Associated Press
articles.title: 100s of migrants crossing Guatemala face new challenges
articles.description: The migrants are less organized, Guatemalan authorities more disciplined and U.S. “advisers” are keeping a watchful eye on a migration event that hasn't achieved caravan status
articles.content:
EL CINCHADO, Guatemala -- 
Less-organized migrants, tighter immigration control by Guatemalan authorities and the presence of U.S. advisers have reduced the likelihood that the hundreds of migrants who departed Honduras will form anything like the cohesive p… [+4105 chars]

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI Associated Press
articles.title: Patient in Japan confirmed as having new virus from China
articles.description: Japan's government says a man treated for pneumonia after returning from China has tested positive for the new coronavirus identified as a possible cause of an outbreak in the Chinese city of Wuhan
articles.content:
TOKYO -- 
Japan's government said Thursday a man treated for pneumonia after returning from China has tested positive for the new coronavirus identified as a possible cause of an outbreak in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
The man developed a fever and coughs on… [+2114 chars]

articles.author: AARON FAVILA and JIM GOMEZ Associated Press
articles.title: Philippine volcano's quakes, cracks send more people fleeing
articles.description: A Philippine volcano is belching smaller plumes of ash but shuddering continuously with earthquakes and cracking roads nearby
articles.content:
LEMERY, Philippines -- 
A Philippine volcano belched smaller plumes of ash Thursday but shuddered continuously with earthquakes and cracked roads in nearby towns, which were blockaded by police due to fears of a bigger eruption.
Taal volcanos crater lake an… [+3067 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Hong Kong leader says special status can endure beyond 2047
articles.description: Hong Kong’s leader Carrie Lam says the ''one country, two systems'' framework under which the city enjoys freedoms unknown in China could continue after 2047 deadline if loyalty to Beijing is upheld
articles.content:
HONG KONG -- 
Hong Kongs leader Carrie Lam says the ''one country, two systems'' framework under which the city enjoys freedoms unknown in China could continue after 2047 deadline if loyalty to Beijing is upheld. 
Lams comments Thursday at the Legislative C… [+872 chars]

articles.title: HBO Max chief dismisses streamer's high-end fee as obstacle
articles.description: An HBO Max executive says its high-end subscription fee won’t be an obstacle to the streaming service’s launch
articles.content:
PASADENA, Calif. -- 
HBO Maxs high-end subscription fee wont be an obstacle to the streaming services launch, said Kevin Reilly, its chief content officer.
People do not shop for their entertainment experiences with price being the primary motivation, Reill… [+2069 chars]

articles.author: EDITH M. LEDERER Associated Press
articles.title: US calls for smaller UN force in Mali, Russia says no change
articles.description: The United States is calling for a reduction in the more than 16,000-strong peacekeeping force in Mali and a new focus on protecting civilians because parties to a 2015 peace deal have made little progress in implementing it
articles.content:

articles.author: YURI KAGEYAMA AP Business Writer
articles.title: Ghosn's Japan lawyer quits after client's flight to Lebanon
articles.description: One of the Japanese lawyers for former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has stepped down from that job after Ghosn fled to Lebanon
articles.content:
TOKYO -- 
One of the Japanese lawyers for former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn has stepped down from that job after Ghosn fled the country.
